Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is light-brown in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394733) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394733)
